page.syntax: Result as A = EVAL(C Expression[,C eval_context[,C eval_cursorstate]])

argument.name: eval_context
argument.description: Optional. The context in which the expression should be evaluated. This can be a list of tables in a CR-LF delimited list. It can also be the name of an open form (suffixed by ".this"), which would evaluate the expression in the context of the form.

page.description: Return the result of the expression (parses an expression stored in a string, and evaluates it).
page.discussion: EVAL() evaluates Expression and returns the result of that expression. This function is useful when the expression to be evaluated is itself constructed by another expression. Contrast with the evaluate_template() function which executes Xbasic code that is stored in a variable.

section.description: Assume that varA = 1, and varB = 2. Assume that theExpression = "varA + varB" :
The following example uses EVAL() to convert a string representation of a fractional number to a number value.
section.example: dim amt as C amt = "7 1/23" ? eval( word(amt,1) )+if(w_count(amt)>1,eval( word(amt,2) ),0) = 7.04348

section.description: The following example uses EVAL() to evaluate an expression in the context of the 'customers' table.
The following example uses EVAL() to evaluate an expression in the context of the 'Customer Information' form.
section.example: dim f as p f = form.view("Customer Information") ?eval("lastname.text",f.name() + ".this") = "Graham "
